There is no cure for COVID-19. There are treatments like ventilators and supplemental oxygen which are designed for example to help someone with rotting lungs breathe. There’s intense pain which can be at least helped by painkillers like acetaminophen (Tylenol in the US). There’s also the standard treatments for nausea, diarrhea, and vomiting. There are some anti-viral drugs (Remdesivir) which may have some modest effect in killing the virus. At best it reduces symptoms somewhat. Hydroxychloroquine is turning out to be worthless. It’s possible we may come up with a treatment that almost qualifies as a cure, possibly a cocktail of anti-viral drugs. A vaccine is our best hope but we may not have one for years. Most viruses can not be cured. We can treat HIV positive people with an impressive pile of medical miracles and get their HIV tests to be negative, but a few weeks after they quit their drugs they are as infected as ever. The only real solution we have right now is to isolate so that fewer people get it and then test extensively and track contacts when someone turns out to be positive. If we can do that the virus will become so rare that essentially no one has it. The path the US seems to be choosing is to let everyone get exposed and get it until so many people have had it that most of our contacts will no longer be contagious and the virus will die out. This is not even proven to be possible because we aren’t sure people can’t get it twice. In any case there is likely to be hundreds of thousands of death, millions of people seriously harmed, millions more really sick for a few weeks, and a whole bunch of countries that won’t let Americans visit. Also people will be miserable because almost everyone will lose a loved one or a friend or coworker.
